field.label: Enabled
field.help: Enable this server.

field.label: Name or Prefix
field.help: Name to identify a static server. When creating a server template, then this prefix is used for the server names to be built.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this server.

field.label: Type
field.help: Either configure a static server or a template to initialize multiple servers with shared parameters.

field.label: FQDN or IP
field.help: Provide either the FQDN or the IP address of this server.

field.label: Service Name or FQDN
field.help: Provide either the FQDN for all the servers this template initializes or a service name to discover the available services via DNS SRV records.

field.label: Number of Servers
field.help: The number of servers this template initializes, i.e. 5 or 1-5.

field.label: Resolvers
field.help: Specify the resolver that the server template should look at to discover available services via DNS.

field.label: Resolver Options
field.help: Add resolver options. Use TAB key to complete typing.
field.hint: Type option name or choose from list.

field.label: Frontend (Socket Origin)
field.help: Select the frontend that provides the UNIX socket. This UNIX socket will be used as the server's address, making it possible to send connections to this frontend. Only frontends that provide the unix@ pattern as listen address can be selected.

field.label: Port
field.help: Provide the TCP or UDP communication port for this server, i.e. 80 or 443. If set, all connections will be sent to this port. If unset, the same port the client connected to will be used.

field.label: Mode
field.help: Sets the operation mode to use for this server.

field.label: Multiplexer Protocol
field.help: Forces the multiplexer's protocol to use for the outgoing connections to this server. It must be compatible with the mode of the backend (TCP or HTTP). It must also be usable on the backend side. Idea behind this option is to bypass the selection of the best multiplexer's protocol for all connections established to this server. Use only when strictly necessary.

field.label: Prefer IP Family
field.help: When DNS resolution is enabled for a server and multiple IP addresses from different families are returned, HAProxy will prefer using an IP address from the selected family.

field.label: SSL
field.help: Enable or disable SSL communication with this server.

field.label: SSL SNI
field.help: The host name sent in the SNI TLS extension to the server.

field.label: Verify SSL Certificate
field.help:
If disabled, server certificate is not verified. Otherwise the certificate provided by the server is verified using CAs and optional CRLs. Please note that this setting can be overriden by the global configuration.
NOTE: It is critically important to verify server certificates when using SSL to connect to servers, otherwise the communication is prone to trivial man-in-the-middle attacks rendering SSL totally useless.

field.label: SSL Verify CA
field.help:
The selected CAs will be used to verify the server certificate. When nothing is selected, the system-wide CA certificate bundle will be used.
To import additional CAs, go to Authority Manager.
field.hint: Type CA name or choose from list.

field.label: SSL Verify CRL
field.help:
This certificate revocation list will be used to verify server's certificate.
To import additional CRLs, go to Certificate Manager.
field.hint: Type CRL name or choose from list.

field.label: SSL Client Certificate
field.help:
This certificate will be sent if the server send a client certificate request.
To import additional certificates, go to Certificate Manager.
field.hint: Type certificate name or choose from list.

field.label: Max Connections
field.help: Specifies the maximal number of concurrent connections that will be sent to this server. The default value is "0" which means unlimited.

field.label: Weight
field.help: Adjust the server's weight relative to other servers.

field.label: Check Interval
field.help: Sets the interval (in milliseconds) for running health checks on this server. This setting takes precedence over default values in health monitors. It can still be overwritten from the backend pool.

field.label: Down Interval
field.help: Sets the interval (in milliseconds) for running health checks on the server when the server state is DOWN. If it is not set HAProxy uses the check interval.

field.label: Port to check
field.help: Provide the TCP communication port to use during check, i.e. 80 or 443.

field.label: Source address
field.help: Sets the source address which will be used when connecting to the server.

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help:
A list of parameters that will be appended to the server line in every backend where this server will be used.
Example: send-proxy
.
